sentence_evaluations.sentence: The gene is responsible for determination of human [cerumen](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Earwax) type (wet or dry ear wax) and presence of underarm [osmidrosis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Osmidrosis) (odor associated with [sweat](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Perspiration) caused by [apocrine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apocrine) secretion), and is associated with [colostrum](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Colostrum) secretion.

**ATP-binding cassette transporter sub-family C member 11**, also **MRP8** (_Multidrug Resistance-Related Protein 8_), is a [membrane transporter](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Membrane_transport_protein) that exports certain molecules from inside a cell.

sentence_evaluations.sentence:
Multiple alternatively spliced transcript variants have been described for this gene.## Molecular genetics

The _ABCC11_ [gene](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gene) is present in the [human genome](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_genome) as two [alleles](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Allele), differing in one [nucleotide](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nucleotide) also known as a [single nucleotide polymorphism (SNP)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Single-nucleotide_polymorphism).

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Applicable because the sentence uses the gene abbreviation '_ABCC11_' which should be italicized.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: '_ABCC11_' is correctly italicized.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: Fully adheres to the requirement by italicizing the gene abbreviation as per imperative standards.

requirement_evaluations.evidence: Uses the abbreviation '_ABCC11_' instead of the full gene name.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: Fully adheres to the best practice of using abbreviations over full gene names.

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Applicable because the sentence uses the human gene '_ABCC11_', which should be written in capitals.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: 'ABCC11' is written in all capitals.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: Fully adheres to the requirement of writing human gene names in capitals.

requirement_evaluations.evidence: Uses '_ABCC11_' correctly in the sentence without redundancy.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: Fully adheres to the recommended usage of gene symbols, avoiding redundancy.

sentence_evaluations.sentence: A SNP in the _ABCC11_ gene on [chromosome 16](<https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chromosome_16_(human)>) at [base](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nucleobase) position 538 of either a [guanine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guanine) or [adenine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adenine) determines two distinct groups of [phenotypes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Phenotype).

sentence_evaluations.sentence:
Multiple alternatively spliced transcript variants have been described for this gene.## Molecular genetics

The _ABCC11_ [gene](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gene) is present in the [human genome](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_genome) as two [alleles](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Allele), differing in one [nucleotide](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nucleotide) also known as a [single nucleotide polymorphism (SNP)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Single-nucleotide_polymorphism).

- [Body odor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Body_odor)## Further Reading

- Bera TK, Lee S, Salvatore G, Lee B, Pastan I.

"MRP8, a new member of ABC transporter superfamily, identified by EST database mining and gene prediction program, is highly expressed in breast cancer." _Molecular Medicine_, volume 7, issue 8, pages 509–16, August 2001.

DOI: [10.1007/BF03401856](https://doi.org/10.1007/BF03401856)

- Yabuuchi H, Shimizu H, Takayanagi S, Ishikawa T.

"Multiple splicing variants of two new human ATP-binding cassette transporters, ABCC11 and ABCC12." _Biochemical and Biophysical Research Communications_, volume 288, issue 4, pages 933–9, November 2001.

"Role of glutathione in the multidrug resistance protein 4 (MRP4/ABCC4)-mediated efflux of cAMP and resistance to purine analogues." _The Biochemical Journal_, volume 361, issue Pt 3, pages 497–503, February 2002.

DOI: [10.1042/0264-6021:3610497](https://doi.org/10.1042/0264-6021:3610497)

- Stríz I, Jaresová M, Lácha J, Sedlácek J, Vítko S.
"MRP 8/14 and procalcitonin serum levels in organ transplantations." _Annals of Transplantation_, volume 6, issue 2, pages 6–9, 2002.
- Tomita H, Yamada K, Ghadami M, Ogura T, Yanai Y, Nakatomi K, Sadamatsu M, Masui A, Kato N, Niikawa N.
"Mapping of the wet/dry earwax locus to the pericentromeric region of chromosome 16." _Lancet_, volume 359, issue 9322, pages 2000–2, June 2002.
